page.title: 12Religion
page.content: The first recorded church of Wroughton was in 956 AD. It was dedicated to St.Helena who became popular in the middle ages, because she was reputed to find Christ's cross at Calvary. The North aisle and tower were built in 1380 AD along with the chancel. The tower was built in 3 stages. The first stage supports the other stages with angled butteresses. There are two animal gargoyles either side of the church below the tower battlements. The tower is sixty feet tall and the internal dimemsions are 17'5" x 15'5". In 1905 the North tower was completely restored and in 1906 a new piece of masonry was added under the battlements on the West side of the church.
